REF: Barnardsville FD #0922 "Carter Feldspar Mine. Peg striking N30E; dipping NW in bt hbl mig & amph layers. Bt-chief platy min. Working 500-800' long. Going up 2 small gullies" {Lesure, 1968, Mica deposits of the BR in NC: U.S.G.S. P.P. 577, pl 4 #98}
LABEL: QTZ, FLD

STRUCTURE: "Peg mined for spar or mica.Has qtz core.Qtz is most dom min. Excavation resulted in a pit 50' high & 150' long. Looks like more excavation than peg. Walls are host rock. Peg must have been quite small. Surface working trend N40E"
